hint.text:
Use the following values for the standard enthalpy of formation \(\Delta_fH^\circleddash\):
\(C_2H_5OH(l) = -277.69 \frac{kJ}{mol}, O_2(g) = 0 \frac{kJ}{mol}, CO_2 = -393.509 \frac{kJ}{mol}, H_2O = -285.83 \frac{kJ}{mol}\)

solution.text:
Use the standard enthalpies of formation to calculate the enthalpy of change for the reaction as follows:
\(\Delta_rH^\circleddash = \sum \Delta_fH^\circleddash_ {products} - \sum \Delta_fH^\circleddash_ {reactants}\)
\(\implies \Delta_rH^\circleddash = ((2 \times -393.509) + (3 \times -285.83)) - (1 \times -277.69) = - 1366.818 \frac{kJ}{mol}\)
